Posts.Content: Happy 2015 everybody, just wanted to say a huge thank you to everyone who takes the time to post on this forum, and to all of you with previous experience for sharing and offering much appreciated advice to others, and such a wonderful community, it feels like having an extra family, without the expense ! I have not needed to post much but have followed many of you since my diagnosis in October, and each day I learn more, share a smile or join the 4am club, but a heartfelt thank you to all as it has truly helped me be calm and be prepared for chemo tomorrow. Over the last month I have gone back over the first chemo discussions and assembled a chemo kit !   I have  the mouth treatment kit, manuka honey, ginger nuts, lip and body lotions etc etc etc all thanks to what you ladies have said helped you.   Now let's hope it all brings some comfort and relief.  You all might find me back on a bit more now, asking questions as the chemo kicks in, no cold cap at my hospital so maybe a tale of woe on hair coming up in the next week or two. Thanks everyone on the eve of my chemo I feel calm and relaxed, as the knowledge is beating the fear of the unknown.  Happy New Year, thanks for reading  and a big hug from me to you all  xxxxxx PS   While my tastebuds are working enjoying a New Year glass of wine and popcorn.
Posts.Title: First FEC Thank You

Posts.Content: I've been to the dentist twice and I'm only on chemo number two.  First was filling falling out and second time half a tooth broke off, both with lots of pain as they left exposed nerves.  Had to show them my chemo cards and they noted drugs on their system, patched the teeth up with temporary fillings but they cannot drill, clean or inject due to risk of infection.  Apparently you need to keep your mouth hydrated  as chemo drys it out and loosens fillings so drink / sip water little and often.  Hope this helps xx
Posts.Title: bad tooth

Posts.Content: Hi Shirley, can you friend me please, so I can private message you.   I have the same rare micro-papillary Breast cancer as you and I am being treated by Stafford hospital.   Thanks. Pauline. Peepee
Posts.Title: Shirleymac

Posts.Content: Morning you early birds, I am five days after first FEC and have survived the nausea by drinking gallons of water and on third large pack of rich tea.  Ask for Emend the antisickness wonder drug, they don't give it out routinely as its expensive for NHS but it seems to work well for those who take it. My taste buds are now shot, hate any bread, toast, chocolates, wine and all those left over Christmas goodies taste horrid ! Oh the joys of Chemo, well tea fairy has just brought a cup of black currant and rhubarb tea which is delicious. good luck this weeks chemo girls and Ali Owl on your Picc line today
Posts.Title: Post 1st chemo!

Posts.Content: White Christmas but sung by Elvis , sort of rock and roll style , shows my age !
Posts.Title: whats your fave xmas song lovely ladies ?

Posts.Content: Lol ,   Must have nodded off waiting for that crispy bacon roll,  makes me smile to think of Ali Owl out in her caravan delivering  us meece on toast.  Now I will just have to wake hubbie up for a cuppa as it's daylight .......   Thanks all, big morning hugs all around, good luck for tomorrow Sue, and Alison so glad that your first chemo went well, I am stalking your stories !,  hey, its nearly the  weekend, PJ Saturday coming up and maybe even PJ Sunday.
Posts.Title: Four in the morning

Posts.Content: Hi all, I have joined the can't sleep club !   I love reading through all your postings in the early hours and I am getting so much advice through the other postings that are going to help when my chemo starts in the next few weeks.  I was always an 8 or more hours sleeper but this new cancer journey has changed  that.  i am also becoming a Candy Crush expert as suggested by others here, might try Pinerest next ! But if anyone has the magical sleep cure please pass it on.   Night all !    Pauline
Posts.Title: Four in the morning

Posts.Content: Hi, that's on my list for tonight, hopefully some good soup recipes, fancy a minestrone and then I can freeze some for chemo week.  I will be on Anastrozone after treatment so looks like I will have years of surfing the net ahead of me .......  will be a better cook and a brilliant games player xxx
Posts.Title: Four in the morning

Posts.Content: Hi Crystal Kitty,  this is exactly what happened to me, had two surgeries to get clear margins after WLE, and at home recovering now before chemo in January.  Just be reassured that your Breast Care Team is doing their very best for you.   Big hug coming your way, I know exactly how you are feeling and all the whirring that your mind is doing !
Posts.Title: Further surgery after Sentinel Node Biopsy

Posts.Content: Morning all, and a very Merry Christmas Eve, I missed my tea fairy this morning as I woke up at midnight    and was wide awake so wrapped presents till 4.30, now I've just woken up to find the tea fairy gone to work !!!   Bah Humbug !   Enjoy the day everyone, happy happy happy xxx
Posts.Title: happy xmas eve lovely ladies !!!

Posts.Content: Dreamthief alias George,  where are you ?????  No advent calendar and its Christmas Eve, thought we would have a special one today and maybe a chocolate would pop out !!   I am devastated, hope all is well and your  not still stuck in the M & S queue for your nibbles !!
Posts.Title: Missing Avent Calendar

Posts.Content: So true, we are the lucky ones xx
Posts.Title: Sometimes I Wonder

Posts.Content: i know exactly how you are feeling, been there three weeks ago, but second op done and all forgotten, just keep moving forward with positivity xx
Posts.Title: Cried all morning but getting back on track ....

Posts.Content: I agree with the above from Mistymoley, take one step at a time or it will blow your mind.  I have had two ops in the last five weeks and have been totally pain free!  like you I was scared of the unknown and thought I would be lying in bed for days in agony ! One minute you are having the cannula fitted, anisthetic goes in, then next thing you  know you are in the recovery room.    Best wishes for the 15th, sending a comforting hug your way xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and lymph nodes removed

Posts.Content: Hi Helen,  I agree with all the advice above,  I have had three FECs now and awaiting the dreaded T, I did it all perfectly first time, lots of water, rest, Manuka honey, mouth care 3/4 times a day and all went well, second FEC got lazy, didn't drink as much, didn't take the honey etc and had more side effects, for number three gone back to doing all the right things and feeling good !  So the advice works hopefully.   Hugs and good luck on the chemo roller coaster xx
Posts.Title: 3rd fec half way

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies and great providers of info,   I know that you cannot use deodorant under the arm after lumpectomy and node removal,  but are baby wipes and talc OK ?   Have become very hot and sweaty since op and obsessed with smells !  Any advice on how to keep fresh .....  Thanks
Posts.Title: Talcum Powder

Posts.Content: Another question ......... Just removed dressing,  are the sterra strips alright to be left by themselves now or would you advise covering them up, its day six and they are still on firmly ???  Thanks for the picture, that's what I look like but times two insertions which was a shock, the surgeon told me one cut and I saw two today,  but the tumour has gone, thank goodness.
Posts.Title: Talcum Powder

Posts.Content: Aaahhh, Comper, sending positive vibes your way and a big Christmas hug, we have all been through this turmoil of feelings and please let us know how you get on, this gang is great for moral support and advice, also light relief, you are not alone xx
Posts.Title: Just joined the roller coaster - help !

Posts.Content: Morning Ali and everyone else, I have been up but with the 6 am diarrorea club.......not nice..  Oh the joys of chemo. I noticed that they had gone missing, a well deserved holiday hopefully x
Posts.Title: G n j
